clinical_study.brief_title: Pharmacokinetics (PK) and Safety Evaluation of Daptomycin in Children Ages 3-24 Months With Proven or Suspected Gram-positive Infections or Peri-Operative Subjects Receiving Prophylactic Antibiotics
clinical_study.official_title: An Evaluation of the Pharmacokinetic Profile and Safety of a Single Dose of Daptomycin in Pediatric Subjects Aged 3 Months to Twenty-Four Months Who Are Concurrently Receiving Standard Antibiotic Therapy for Proven or Suspected Bacterial Infection Including Peri-Operative Prophylactic Use of Antibiotics

brief_summary.textblock: This is a research study designed to look at the pharmacokinetics (distribution, breakdown, and removal) and tolerability of a single dose of daptomycin in patients aged 3 months to 24 months who have proven or suspected infections that are caused by a specific group of bacteria (called Gram-positive bacteria)or perioperative subjects that are receiving prophylactic antibiotics .

primary_outcome.measure: PK of single dose daptomycin in subjects between 3 and 24 months who are receiving standard antibiotic therapy for a Gram-positive infection, including subjects that are receiving prophylactic antibiotics peri-operatively.

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety of a single dose daptomycin in subjects between 3 and 24 months, who are receiving standard antibiotic therapy for a Gram-positive infection, including subjects that are receiving prophylactic antibiotics peri-operatively.

arm_group.description: Group 1: Ages 13 months to 24 months inclusive. Six subjects dosed at 6 mg/kg as a 30 minute infusion.
Group 2: Ages 7 months to 12 months inclusive: Six subjects will receive a dose of 4 mg/kg as a 30 minute infusion
Group 3: Ages 3 months to 6 months inclusive: Six subjects will receive a dose of 4 mg/kg as a 30 minute infusion.
